utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, what can I do for you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi um, yeah so I, I just came here today um, because I've just been feeling um, like I have this really sore throat for the last uh, week, and I've also been getting some chills over the last few nights as well. Um, so yeah, I just came to check it out.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, okay, and um, when did uh, so your sore throat started um, a week ago. What about um, the chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, chills, I've been feeling them over the last few nights um, and I've also just been feeling very tired and um, over the last whole week as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, have you had any difficulties swallowing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, I definitely feel like uh, I do get some pain ones following, but it may be just with the sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And um, have you had, uh, have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any uh, stuffy nose or runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No um, sinus congestion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, what about uh, cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, not, not, no cough really. I've also noticed, also like the back of my throat, when I look in the mirror, is like just very red and like angry looking.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And um, any difficulties breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any um, pain in your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, do you feel like your heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your bowel movements, or your urinary, or any urinary concerns?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No belly pain or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um, so uh, are you um, do you have any medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been pretty healthy all my life.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any medications that you've been on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and um, any medical conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I think um, my mom has diabetes, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. And um, who do you currently live with? Or do you live alone?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with uh, my mom.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anyone else at the house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's just us two.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um, and any um, recent exposures to anyone who might be sick.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um my, my boyfriend, he kind of had similar symptoms, I would say a few weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, and um, did he, did he get um, did he see a doctor?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he didn't want to go to the doctor, and it kind of just resolved, like he, it went away on its own.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, alright. Um, and do you um, do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just on the weekends maybe, uh, some wine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And what about um, marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um just socially, like right now there's no parties, but like when I'm at parties.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, what about alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, so just uh, socially again.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, yeah.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right now, with my mom drinking every now and then.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, okay. Um, alright, well that's all the questions I had, and uh, sorry one more. Have you been up to date with your immunizations so far?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been having all my immunizations. Uh, I also feel like, so with a sore throat, I also have some um, pain on the sides, like on my, on my neck. Like I almost feel like some lumps on both sides.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I see, I see. Okay, okay. Um, so I guess I, at this point I would like to maybe have it, examine you, just have a look inside your throat, maybe feel your neck for those lumps, and uh, then decide what to do from there. Um, given your symptoms, um, this could be a viral infection, or um, it could be a bacterial infection caused by um, bacteria called, or I guess, strep, strep throat. It could also be uh, mono. Um, but I'll uh, I'll have a look, we'll do the rapid strep test and uh, based on those results, we'll decide what to do. If it is strep, you might require antibiotics. If not, if it's mono and if we can do maybe a blood test for that, you might have to um, not engage in, in physical activity um, or exercise, vigorous activity, or like sports for the next couple of weeks or months as, as that can be, uh, as that can cause problems if you get hit in the, in your belly. It could cause your spleen to rupture and sometimes your spleen become very big if you do have mono, but we'll discuss all of that a little bit more after we do uh, the strep test. We'll also check your temperature, um, and see um, how you're doing. Have you been taking anything to help yourself, to help soothe your sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, just some lozenges.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so just continue uh, just drinking water and taking lozenges just to um, provide some comfort for yourself, and we'll do the test, then we can chat a bit more after.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
